perturbation.original_text:
As used herein, the following terms shall have the meanings ascribed to them below.

"Affiliate" means, when used with respect to any specified Person, a Person that directly or indirectly through one or more intermediaries, controls,  is controlled by, or is under common control with, such specified Person. For the purposes of this definition, "control" (including the terms  "controlled by" and "under common control with") with respect to the
perturbation.changed_text:
As used herein, the following terms shall have the meanings ascribed to them below.

"Affiliate" means, when used with respect to any specified Person, a Person that directly controls another Person through direct ownership. For the purposes of this definition, "control" (including the terms  "controlled by" and "under common control with") with respect to the
perturbation.explanation: The original definition includes indirect control through intermediaries, while the modified definition only considers direct control. This creates a contradiction as to which entities qualify as affiliates, affecting rights and responsibilities tied to affiliate status throughout the contract.

perturbation.original_text: Licensee shall monitor and censor all Content on the websites associated with the Licensed Domain Names, including  without limitation Content posted by end users. Licensor shall also have the right to monitor and censor Content of the websites associated with  Licensed Domain Names. Licensee shall remove any offending Content, including, but not limited to, any illegal materials, pornographic, obscene  or sexually explicit materials, materials of a violent nature, or politically sensitive materials, from such websites as soon as possible after it becomes  aware of such offending Content but in no event later than the timeframe prescribed by the Governmental Authority after receipt of oral or written  notice from Licensor or such Governmental Authority.
perturbation.changed_text: Licensee shall monitor Content on the websites associated with the Licensed Domain Names, including  without limitation Content posted by end users. Licensor may monitor Content of the websites associated with  Licensed Domain Names. Licensee shall endeavor to remove any offending Content, including, but not limited to, any illegal materials, pornographic, obscene  or sexually explicit materials, materials of a violent nature, or politically sensitive materials, from such websites as soon as possible after it becomes  aware of such offending Content.
perturbation.explanation: The original text mandates that the licensee censor all content and remove offending content as soon as possible. The modified text removes the word censor and uses the phrase 'endeavor to remove,' weakening the Licensee's obligation. It also removes the section mentioning the timeframe prescribed by the Governmental Authority after receipt of oral or written notice from Licensor or such Governmental Authority, introducing ambiguity regarding the timeframe.
perturbation.location: 3.3. Website Monitoring and Censoring. (a) Licensee Obligations

perturbation.original_text: Confidential Information. In performing its obligations under this Agreement, either Party (the "Recipient") may obtain certain Confidential  Information of the other Party. For purposes of this Agreement, "Confidential Information" shall mean information, documents and other tangible  things, provided by either Party to the other, in whatever form, relating to such Party's business and marketing, including such Party's financial  information, personal information, customer lists, product plans and marketing plans, whether alone or in its compiled form and whether marked as  confidential or not. The Recipient shall maintain in
perturbation.changed_text: Confidential Information. In performing its obligations under this Agreement, either Party (the "Recipient") may obtain certain Confidential  Information of the other Party. For purposes of this Agreement, "Confidential Information" shall mean information, documents and other tangible  things, provided by either Party to the other, in a tangible, written form, relating to such Party's business and marketing, including such Party's financial  information, personal information, customer lists, product plans and marketing plans, whether alone or in its compiled form and marked as  confidential. The Recipient shall maintain in
perturbation.explanation: The original definition includes information in whatever form, whether marked as confidential or not. The modified definition restricts Confidential Information to tangible, written form and also requires the information to be marked as confidential. This creates a contradiction, as some information might be considered confidential under one definition but not the other. If it isn't in tangible and written form, it won't be considered confidential.
